summary: Adds more barrels, strongboxes and safes to many vendors' dwellings with loot corresponding with the owner's profession. No more walking out empty-handed from a burglary job!
descriptionHtml:
[size=3]Ever getting tired of trying to roleplay a burglar but end up roleplaying a beggar because you can't find ANYTHING valuable in shops? Fear not! This is the last day you'll ever have to worry about walking out of a burglary job empty handed. It's NOT happening again.
[/size]
[size=4]Brief summary[/size]
This mod basically adds multiple containers like safes, barrels, and strongboxes with corresponding loot to the owner's profession, to many of the interior vendors' shops (see below for a list). This means that I have added barrels with alchemy ingredients to all the apothecaries (and locked strongboxes in some), a safe with jewelry in clothing shops like the Radiant Raiment in Solitude, and such.Â  [u]The owners of the locked safes and strongboxes are carrying the keys[/u], so you have a choice between pickpocketing the owner or trying to lockpick your way in (iMMERsivE..)

So the mod adds:
- Barrels
- Safes
- Strongboxes
- Keys (for the Adept to Master-level strongboxes and safes) in the pockets of the owners
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[size=4]Containers added to:[/size]
[size=3]Windhelm:[/size]
[size=2]- The White Phial[/size]
[size=2]- Sadri's Used Wares[/size]
[size=2]- Blacksmith Quarters[/size]

[size=3]Solitude:
[/size]- Bits and pieces
- Angeline's Aromatics
- Radiant Raiment
- The Winking Skeever
- Fletcher
- Blacksmith Quarters

[size=3]Morthal:
[/size]- The Mortar and Pestile

[size=3]Markarth:
[/size]- Arnleif and Sons Trading Company
- The Hag's Cure

[size=3]Riften:
[/size]- The Scorched Hammer
- The Pawned Prawn
- Elgrim's Elixirs

[size=3]Winterhold:
[/size]- Birna's oddments

[size=3]Whiterun:
[/size]- Warmaiden's
- The Drunken Huntsman
- Belethor's General Goods
- Arcadia's Cauldron

[size=3]Riverwood:
[/size]- Riverwood Trader

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[size=3]Future plans (when I actually find the time..):
[/size]- Safes and lockboxes in citizens' dwellings
- More varied loot

The only way this mod can collide with any other is by combining it with a mod that replaces big portions of the interiors mentioned above, or a mod that touches certain NPCs inventory, as I have placed keys to their lockboxes / safes in their inventory.

If you have any issues don't hesistate to post them in the forum section!
author: ka1zyGONEcrazy
